keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility and died from severe injuries.
David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges.
The body-camera footage of the beating, though silent, showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, and the video was central to the prosecution's case.
All guards were accused of acting together as a gang with 'depraved indifference to human life,' which is a key legal standard in murder charges.
William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, took over the case after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representing officers in civil lawsuits.
The case is part of a broader investigation into prison guard misconduct, including the beating of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility in March 2025.
Multiple guards have pleaded guilty to lesser charges, and three others are cooperating with prosecutors, indicating a pattern of systemic failure in prison oversight.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, died after being violently beaten three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, with the final beating captured on silent body-camera footage. A jury found David Kingsley guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges. The prosecution argued that all guards acted as a gang with depraved indifference to human life, and the video evidence showed officers punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck. The case was prosecuted by William Fitzpatrick, who took over after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to civil litigation involving prison guards. This incident is part of a broader pattern of misconduct, including the March 2025 beating and death of inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility. Multiple guards have pleaded guilty to lesser charges, and several are cooperating with prosecutors, highlighting systemic failures in prison oversight and accountability.
title: Former New York state prison guard found guilty in death of inmate beaten, 2 others acquitted
